body_html: feature importances are currently calculated with a TF graph, so can't really expose as a property or a function in the estimator, it only makes sense in the context of a tf.Session (which only exists during training or eval, which is controlled under the hood of estimators). One option is to include it as an eval metric, would that be ok?

body: feature importances are currently calculated with a TF graph, so can't really expose as a property or a function in the estimator, it only makes sense in the context of a tf.Session (which only exists during training or eval, which is controlled under the hood of estimators).  One option is to include it as an eval metric, would that be ok?
